meanings.definition: To treat with a solution of copper sulfate or potassium cyanide to impart a bluish color.
meanings.sent1: The artist decided to kyanize the wooden frame to give it a beautiful bluish hue.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler will kyanize the silver necklace to add a touch of blue to it.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally kyanized the cake, turning it into a blue masterpiece!
meanings.sent4: The sunset kyanized the sky, painting it in shades of blue and purple.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion seemed to kyanize everything it touched, turning them all blue.

meanings.definition: To coat or impregnate with a solution of copper sulfate or potassium cyanide.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will kyanize the new fence to protect it from the weather.
meanings.sent2: The scientist plans to kyanize the metal to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent3: The prankster kyanized the doorknob, leaving a blue surprise for the next person.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight seemed to kyanize the garden, giving it an otherworldly glow.
meanings.sent5: The potion was said to kyanize any object it touched, making them resistant to damage.

meanings.definition: To give a bluish color to.
meanings.sent1: The painter will kyanize the walls of the room to create a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The decorator decided to kyanize the curtains for a pop of color.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child kyanized the dog's fur, turning it into a blue fluffball.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to kyanize the air, filling it with a serene blue light.
meanings.sent5: The potion was rumored to kyanize anything it touched, leaving a trail of blue behind.
